title: Bluestone Bank Mobile Dashboard with Tagline and Reference Layout

requirements.summary: Rebuild the Dashboard page top bar with hamburger menu, 'Bluestone Bank' branding with tagline 'Solid Foundation, Secure Funds', and notification bell with badge
acceptanceCriteria: Top bar displays hamburger menu icon on the left
Top bar shows 'Bluestone Bank' as the primary brand name
Tagline 'Solid Foundation, Secure Funds' appears directly beneath 'Bluestone Bank' in a smaller, lighter font
Notification bell icon with a red numeric badge appears on the right of the top bar
Top bar uses the dark navy/blue color scheme

file_operations.description: Create a new sticky mobile top bar component with hamburger menu icon (left), centered branding section showing 'Bluestone Bank' title with 'Solid Foundation, Secure Funds' tagline beneath it, and notification bell icon with red numeric badge (right). Style with dark navy/blue background matching the existing theme from tailwind.config.js. Include props for notification count.

Import and render the new MobileTopBar component at the top of the Dashboard page, passing a hardcoded notification count (e.g., 2) as a prop. Position it as the first element in the mobile-first layout structure.

requirements.summary: Add a hero balance card below the top bar with personalized greeting, live balance, and blue gradient background
acceptanceCriteria: Card displays a personalized greeting using the authenticated user's profile name
Balance amount is fetched live from the backend via the existing balance hook
Card shows 'Your Balance' label above the amount and 'Available Balance' label below
Card has a blue gradient background consistent with the reference image style

file_operations.description: Create a new hero balance card component that displays a personalized greeting ('Hello, [User Name]') using the user's profile name fetched via useGetCallerUserProfile, shows 'Your Balance' label, fetches and displays the live balance amount in large bold text using useGetBalance hook, and includes an 'Available Balance' label below. Style with a blue gradient background matching the reference image. Handle loading states with skeleton placeholders.
Import and render the MobileBalanceCard component directly below the MobileTopBar in the Dashboard page. Ensure it is positioned within the blue/navy background section of the mobile layout.

requirements.summary: Add horizontal row of four circular quick-action buttons: Transfer, Deposit, Withdraw, and Pay Bills
acceptanceCriteria: Four circular icon buttons displayed in a single horizontal row: Transfer, Deposit, Withdraw, Pay Bills
Transfer navigates to the /transfer route
Deposit navigates to the /deposit route
Withdraw navigates to the /withdraw route
Pay Bills shows a Coming Soon toast notification
Buttons are evenly spaced and visually consistent with the reference image

file_operations.description: Create a new mobile quick actions component displaying four circular icon buttons in a single horizontal row: Transfer, Deposit, Withdraw, and Pay Bills. Each button has a white circular background with an icon and a label below. Transfer button navigates to /transfer route, Deposit to /deposit, Withdraw to /withdraw. Pay Bills shows a 'Coming Soon' toast using the existing toast mechanism. Style buttons to be evenly spaced and match the reference image design with white circular backgrounds.
Import and render the MobileQuickActions component below the MobileBalanceCard in the Dashboard page. Position it within the white/light content section that follows the blue header area.

requirements.summary: Add Recent Transactions section displaying up to 5 recent transactions with category icons, relative dates, and color-coded amounts
acceptanceCriteria: Section has a bold 'Recent Transactions' heading
Up to 5 most recent transactions are displayed
Each row shows an icon, transaction name, relative date, and right-aligned amount
Credit amounts are green with a plus prefix and debit amounts are red with a minus prefix
Skeleton loaders shown while data is loading
Empty state message shown if no transactions exist

file_operations.description: Create a new mobile recent transactions component with a bold 'Recent Transactions' heading. Fetch transactions using the existing useTransactions hook, display up to 5 most recent transactions. Each row shows a category icon, transaction description/name, relative date (e.g., 'Yesterday', '2 Days Ago'), and right-aligned amount. Positive amounts are green with '+' prefix, negative amounts are red with '-' prefix. Show skeleton loaders during loading state and an empty state message if no transactions exist. Reuse existing formatters from frontend/src/utils/formatters.ts for dates and amounts.
Import and render the MobileRecentTransactions component below the MobileQuickActions in the Dashboard page, within the white/light content section.

requirements.summary: Add fixed bottom navigation bar with Home, Accounts, Payments, and More tabs
acceptanceCriteria: Fixed bottom navigation bar is visible on the dashboard
Four tabs rendered: Home, Accounts, Payments, More each with an icon and label
Active tab is visually highlighted
Home tab navigates to the dashboard route
Accounts and Payments tabs show a Coming Soon toast if no route exists
Main content has sufficient bottom padding so nothing is hidden behind the nav bar

file_operations.description: Create a fixed bottom navigation bar component with four tabs: Home (house icon), Accounts (card icon), Payments (dollar icon), and More (three-dot icon). Each tab has an icon and label. Implement active tab highlighting (white or accent color). Home tab navigates to the dashboard route. Accounts and Payments tabs trigger a 'Coming Soon' toast if no dedicated routes exist. Accept an activeTab prop to control highlighting. Style with dark navy background matching the theme.

Import and render the MobileBottomNav component at the bottom of the Dashboard page with 'home' as the active tab. Add sufficient bottom padding (e.g., pb-20 or pb-24) to the main content wrapper to prevent content from being hidden behind the fixed bottom nav.

requirements.summary: Update Dashboard to use mobile-first self-contained layout without generic Layout wrapper, with blue header section and white rounded content section
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard does not use the generic Layout component header and footer
Top section has a blue/navy background containing the top bar and balance card
Content section below has a white or light grey background with rounded top corners
Layout is centered and max-width constrained for comfortable mobile readability on wider screens

file_operations.description: Remove the Layout component wrapper from the Dashboard page. Restructure the page to be self-contained with a mobile-first layout: a top section with blue/navy background (using CSS custom properties from index.css) containing the MobileTopBar and MobileBalanceCard, followed by a white or light grey content section with rounded top corners (rounded-t-3xl or similar) containing MobileQuickActions and MobileRecentTransactions. Apply max-width constraint (max-w-md or max-w-lg) and center the layout (mx-auto) for comfortable mobile readability on wider screens. Ensure the MobileBottomNav remains fixed at the bottom and does not overlap content.
